TRIAL.Definition: a formal examination of evidence in court to decide if someone is guilty

HILLTOP.Definition: located at the top part of a hill

ETRUSCAN ARCHES.Definition: ancient curved structures built by the Etruscans

FLOCK.Definition: gather or go in large numbers

PEERS.Definition: people of the same age or status

SETTLED ON.Definition: decided on it after considering other options

FLATSHARE.Definition: an arrangement where people share an apartment

TEAR OFF.Definition: remove it by pulling it quickly

STUDIOUS.Definition: spending a lot of time studying or reading

REFUSED.Definition: said no to it, were not willing to do it

DUVET.Definition: soft, flat bag used as a covering on the bed

RAISED THE ALARM.Definition: alerted or informed others about it

BROKEN.Definition: speaking (the language) with difficulty and with a lot of mistakes

BLUR.Definition: something not clear or difficult to remember

DETAINED.Definition: kept in custody or in prison

CONVICT.Definition: find them guilty of the crime

HANDLE.Definition: the part of it designed to be held by the hand

BLADE.Definition: the flat cutting part of the knife

A MATTER OF.Definition: no more than (the specified period of time)

UPSET STOMACH.Definition: feeling of sickness in the stomach

STABBED.Definition: pierced or hit with a pointed object

FLEE.Definition: run away from danger or trouble

SALACIOUS.Definition: showing too much interest in sexual matters

RACIER.Definition: more exciting or interesting in a sexual way

TABLOID.Definition: a type of newspaper with popular news

GOSSIP.Definition: casual reports about other people's private lives

TEMPTRESS.Definition: a woman who tries to sexually attract men

CARTWHEELS.Definition: a gymnastic movement turning sideways on hands and feet

APPEAL.Definition: request it to be reviewed by a higher court

APPEALS.Definition: requests for the decisions to be reviewed

FORENSIC.Definition: related to scientific methods used to solve crimes

CONTAMINATED.Definition: made unreliable by being mixed with irrelevant material

PERJURY.Definition: lying to the police or in court

SENTENCED.Definition: given the punishment by the court

SERVED.Definition: spent time in prison as a punishment

STAND TRIAL.Definition: be judged in a court of law

PING PONG.Definition: a back-and-forth exchange, activity between them

EXTRADITION.Definition: the act of sending someone back to another country to face trial

EXTRADITING.Definition: sending her back to another country for trial

EXTRADITE.Definition: send someone back to another country for trial

EXONERATED.Definition: freed from blame or found innocent

DEVIANT.Definition: different from the norm in a bad way, weirdo

FLED.Definition: ran away from danger or trouble

SCRATCHED THE SURFACE.Definition: covered a small part of the topic
